arxiv-mcp-server.description: The ArXiv MCP Server provides a bridge between AI assistants and arXiv's research repository through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows AI models to search for papers and access their content in a programmatic way.

tools.name: search_papers
tools.description: Search for papers on arXiv with advanced filtering

biomcp.description: BioMCP is an open source (MIT License) toolkit that empowers AI assistants and agents with specialized biomedical knowledge. Built following the Model Context Protocol (MCP), it connects AI systems to authoritative biomedical data sources, enabling them to answer questions about clinical trials, scientific literature, and genomic variants with precision and depth.

tools.name: trial_protocol_getter
tools.description:
Fetch core protocol information for a clinical trial.

    Retrieves essential protocol details including:
    - Official title and brief summary
    - Study status and sponsor information
    - Study design (type, phase, allocation, masking)
    - Eligibility criteria
    - Primary completion date

excel.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that reads and writes MS Excel data.

tools.name: excel_describe_sheets
tools.description: List all sheet information of specified Excel file

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

tools.name: excel_read_sheet
tools.description: Read values from Excel sheet with pagination.

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

range.description: Range of cells to read in the Excel sheet (e.g., "A1:C10"). [default: first paging range]

sheetName.description: Sheet name in the Excel file

filesystem.description: Node.js server implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) for filesystem operations.

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Use the 'head' parameter to read only the first N lines of a file, or the 'tail' parameter to read only the last N lines of a file. Only works within allowed directories.

tail.description: If provided, returns only the last N lines of the file

head.description: If provided, returns only the first N lines of the file

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Use this to understand which directories are available before trying to access files.

maven-deps-server.description: An MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides tools for checking Maven dependency versions. This server enables LLMs to verify Maven dependencies and retrieve their latest versions from Maven Central Repository.

tools.name: get_latest_release
tools.description: Get the latest release version of a Maven dependency (excludes pre-releases by default)

excludePreReleases.description: Whether to exclude pre-release versions (alpha, beta, milestone, RC, snapshot). Default: true

mcp-simple-arxiv.description: An MCP server that provides access to arXiv papers through their API.

tools.name: search_papers
tools.description:
Search for papers on arXiv by title and abstract content.
            
You can use advanced search syntax:
- Search in title: ti:"search terms"
- Search in abstract: abs:"search terms"
- Search by author: au:"author name"
- Combine terms with: AND, OR, ANDNOT
- Filter by category: cat:cs.AI (use list_categories tool to see available categories)

Examples:
- "machine learning"  (searches all fields)
- ti:"neural networks" AND cat:cs.AI  (title with category)
- au:bengio AND ti:"deep learning"  (author and title)

query.description: Search query to match against paper titles and abstracts

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 10)

tools.name: get_paper_data
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific paper including abstract and available formats

music-analysis.description: This repository contains a Model Context Provider (MCP) that uses MCP and librosa for audio analysis on audio in local, youtube link, or audio link.

tools.name: load
tools.description:
Loads an audio file and returns the path to the audio time series
Offset and duration are optional, in seconds.
Be careful, you will never know the name of the song.

tools.name: get_duration
tools.description: Returns the total duration (in seconds) of the given audio time series.

tools.name: tempo
tools.description:
Estimates the tempo (in BPM) of the given audio time series using librosa.
Offset and duration are optional, in seconds.

tools.name: beat_track
tools.description:
Computes the beat track of the given audio time series using librosa.
The beat track is a representation of the audio signal in terms of its
rhythmic content, which is useful for music analysis.
The beat track is computed using the following parameters:
- hop_length: The number of samples between frames.
- start_bpm: The initial estimate of the tempo (in BPM).
- tightness: The tightness of the beat tracking (default is 100).
- units: The units of the beat track (default is "frames"). It can be frames, samples, time.

pdf-reader-mcp.description: Empower your AI agents (like Cline) with the ability to securely read and extract information (text, metadata, page count) from PDF files within your project context using a single, flexible tool.

tools.name: read_pdf
tools.description: Reads content/metadata from one or more PDFs (local/URL). Each source can specify pages to extract.

path.description: Relative path to the local PDF file.

pages.description: Extract text only from specific pages (1-based) or ranges for *this specific source*. If provided, 'include_full_text' for the entire request is ignored for this source.

sources.description: An array of PDF sources to process, each can optionally specify pages.

include_full_text.description: Include the full text content of each PDF (only if 'pages' is not specified for that source).

include_metadata.description: Include metadata and info objects for each PDF.

include_page_count.description: Include the total number of pages for each PDF.

searxng.description: A powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing comprehensive document processing capabilities.

tools.name: document_reader
tools.description: Read content from non-image document-files at specified paths, supporting various file formats: .pdf, .docx, .txt, .html, .csv

filePath.description: Path to the file to be read

tools.name: docx_to_html
tools.description: Convert DOCX to HTML while preserving formatting

inputPath.description: Path to the input DOCX file

outputDir.description: Directory where HTML should be saved

tools.name: excel_read
tools.description: Read Excel file and convert to JSON format while preserving structure

inputPath.description: Path to the input Excel file

includeHeaders.description: Whether to include headers in the output

word-document-server.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for creating, reading, and manipulating Microsoft Word documents. This server enables AI assistants to work with Word documents through a standardized interface, providing rich document editing capabilities.

tools.name: get_document_text
tools.description: Extract all text from a Word document.

playwright.description: Synthetic Playwright-like web client backed by static HTML snapshots. Provides browser automation capabilities for navigating to URLs and extracting page content.

tools.name: playwright_navigate
tools.description: Navigate to a URL and return a page handle. Returns page metadata if the URL exists in the corpus, or an error if not found.

tools.name: playwright_get_visible_html
tools.description: Return the visible HTML content for a given URL. This fetches the full HTML of the page.

url.description: The URL to fetch HTML from

tools.name: playwright_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of a web page. Returns metadata about the captured page.

url-search.description: Search service for discovering URLs in the synthetic web corpus. Use this to find relevant web pages before fetching them with the playwright server.

tools.name: search_urls
tools.description: Search for relevant URLs in the synthetic web corpus. Returns a list of matching URLs with their titles and descriptions.

query.description: Search query to find relevant URLs

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 5)
